ArrayList sessionConfigList

Detailed Description

A special version of ConnectionSetup, used to get the session and template information from a single transmitter.

See also:
CollectorSetupManager
Version:
Id
ConnectionSetupThread.java,v 1.5 2005/04/08 12:48:10 guyg Exp

ConnectionConfig  connectionConfig,
LogHandler  log
)  [inline]
 

Create a connection setup thread.

Parameters:
collectorConfig The collector context.
connectionConfig The connection configuration.
log The log for messages. Often this will be different from the thread used for transferring data because we want to show progress separately (e.g., on a GUI during configuration). 
00033                                                  {
00034         super(collectorConfig, connectionConfig, null, log, 0);
00035         this.runException      = new Exception("Not finished"); // in case somebody checks before it's finished.
00036         this.vendorString      = new StringBuffer();
00037         this.sessionConfigList = new ArrayList();

Request the sessions and the templates for each session from the transmitter.

00134                                                                                                     {

00136         log.info(this, "requestSessionAndTemplateInfo", "VendorString(" + vendorString + ")");
00137         log.info(this, "requestSessionAndTemplateInfo", "Processing the " + sessionConfigList.size() + " sessions");
00138         if (sessionConfigList.size() == 0) {
00139             log.warn(this, "requestSessionAndTemplateInfo",
00140                      "No sessions: check for being properly registered with transmitter " + connection);
00141         }
00142         for (Iterator it = sessionConfigList.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
00143             SessionConfig session= (SessionConfig)it.next();
00144             ArrayList sessionTemplateConfigList =
00145                 requestTemplatesAndFields((byte)session.getId());
00146             session.setTemplates(sessionTemplateConfigList);
00147         }
00148         log.info(this, "requestSessionAndTemplateInfo",
00149                  "End processing the " + sessionConfigList.size() + " sessions");
00150     }

final void com::xacct::CRANE::collector::ConnectionSetupThread::requestSessions (   )  throws ConnectionIOException, ProtocolMalformedMsgException, DataException, ConfigException [inline, private]
 

Get the sessions from the transmitter.

00160                                        {
00161 
00162         // XXX This code only works if next response from transmitter
00163         // is GET_SESS_RSP ...  ought to be done with callback on
00164         // request id
00165 
00166         vendorString.setLength(0);
00167         sessionConfigList.clear();
00168 
00169         ProtocolMsgGET_SESS msgGET_SESS =
00170             new ProtocolMsgGET_SESS(getNextRequestId());
00171         msgGET_SESS.sendMsg(connection);
00172 
00173         // It's not a good idea to wait forever here, just in case the
00174         // TCP connection doesn't respond. We'll use the
00175         // XXX ProtocolInfoRequest timeout, even though it's not really
00176         // intended for this.
00177         ProtocolMsg responseMsg =
00178             ProtocolMsg.readMsg(connection, "response to", msgGET_SESS,
00179                                 connectionConfig.getConnectTimeout());
00180         log.info(this, "requestSessions",
00181                  "GET_SESS_RSP response: " + responseMsg.toStringLong());
00182 
00183         if (! (responseMsg instanceof ProtocolMsgGET_SESS_RSP)) {
00184             throw new DataException(this, "requestSessions",
00185                                     "Expected GET_SESS_RSP from request message " + msgGET_SESS +
00186                                     " but received: " + responseMsg);
00187         }
00188 
00189         ProtocolMsgGET_SESS_RSP response = (ProtocolMsgGET_SESS_RSP)responseMsg;
00190         if (msgGET_SESS.requestId != response.requestId) {
00191             throw new DataException(this, "requestSessions",
00192                                     "Unexpected request ID (" + response.requestId +
00193                                     " when expecting " + msgGET_SESS.requestId + " from request message " +
00194                                     msgGET_SESS + " ... whose response was " + responseMsg);
00195         }
00196 
00197         vendorString.append(response.vendorString);
00198         this.sessionConfigList = response.sessionConfigList;
00199     }

00211                                                                                                     {

00213         // XXX This code only works if next response from transmitter is GET_TMPL_RSP ...
00214         // ought to be done with callback on request id
00215 
00216         ProtocolMsgGET_TMPL msgGET_TMPL =
00217             new ProtocolMsgGET_TMPL((byte)sessionId, getNextRequestId());

00219 
00220         // It's not a good idea to wait forever here, just in case the

00244     }

synchronized void com::xacct::CRANE::collector::ConnectionSetupThread::runLoop (   )  throws ProtocolMalformedMsgException, DataException, ConfigException, ConnectionIOException [inline, protected]
 

The overridden loop that the thread runs.

See also:
ConnectionThread::run

ConnectionThread::runLoop

Exceptions:
ConfigException If there's something wrong with the configuration.
ConnectionIOException If something went wrong with the connection to the transmitter.
DataException If we didn't get what we expected from the transmitter.
ProtocolMalformedMsgException If there was something wrong in a message from the transmitter.

Reimplemented from com::xacct::CRANE::collector::ConnectionThread.

00088                                                                                                     {
00089         try {
00090             log.info(this, "runLoop",
00091                      "Trying UDP connection to transmitter for version and port negotiation ...");
00092             makeConnection();
00093 
00094             if (isRunning) {
00095                 requestSessionAndTemplateInfo();
00096             }
00097             log.info(this, "runLoop",
00098                      "Finished getting sessions and templates");
00099             this.runException = null; // Indicate that all is well
00100         } catch (ConnectionIOException e) {
00101             log.error(this, "runLoop",
00102                       "error with transmitter (client) " +
00103                       connectionConfig.transmitterAndPortString() +
00104                       ": " + e.getOriginalMsg() + " ... caused by: " + e.getCause());
00105             this.runException = e;
00106         } catch(Exception e) {
00107             e.printStackTrace();
00108             log.error(this, "runLoop",
00109                       "error with transmitter (client) " +
00110                       connectionConfig.transmitterAndPortString() +
00111                       ": " + e);
00112             this.runException = e;
00113         }
00114 
00115         if (this.connection != null) {
00116             this.connection.close();
00117             this.connection = null; // make sure the connection is gone
00118         }
00119 
00120         // XXX The following is a kludge because of bad structuring
00121         // of the run() and runLoop() methods.
00122         this.isRunning = false; // make sure upper level doesn't keep on trying
00123     }
